title: Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show H3 - Dec 22 2021
itunes:title: Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show H3 - Dec 22 2021
description:
Former NFL coach Dick Vermeil joins Clay to talk about the movie American Underdog, which tells the inspiring story of Kurt Warner going from grocery store employee to Hall of Fame quarterback. "I've seen it three times. Each time I see it I like it better because it makes me think more about the whole process," says Vermeil, who is portrayed in the film by actor Dennis Quaid. "But it's more than a story about a quarterback. It's a life story." Spider-Man had the second-highest opening weekend of all time: "That is an important message that is being sent by the general public," Clay astutely noted. At some point, you have to stand up and say your fears don't cancel my freedoms. Welcome to the party, pal! CNN's Brian Stelter finally asks a relevant question: "Shouldn't we be doing more to protect children by letting them live normal lives?"

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

Follow Clay & Buck on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/clayandbuck

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

Former NFL coach Dick Vermeil joins Clay to talk about the movie American Underdog, which tells the inspiring story of Kurt Warner going from grocery store employee to Hall of Fame quarterback. "I've seen it three times. Each time I see it I like it better because it makes me think more about the whole process," says Vermeil, who is portrayed in the film by actor Dennis Quaid. "But it's more than a story about a quarterback. It's a life story." Spider-Man had the second-highest opening weekend of all time: "That is an important message that is being sent by the general public," Clay astutely noted. At some point, you have to stand up and say your fears don't cancel my freedoms. Welcome to the party, pal! CNN's Brian Stelter finally asks a relevant question: "Shouldn't we be doing more to protect children by letting them live normal lives?"
